de.mukis.config4cli

Class CommandLineConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mukis.config4cli.CommandLineConfig

  • public class CommandLineConfig
extends Object
    Parses a CommandLine into a Config object.
    Author:
    muki

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      CommandLineConfig() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static com.typesafe.config.Config fromCommandLine(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine cmd)
      Parsing rules non-arg options option-name = true Example call: -debug single-arg options option-name = argument Example call: -file /absolute/path property-arg options option-name { prop1 = val1 prop2 = val2 } Example call: -D prop1=val1 -D prop2=val2 multi-arg options option-name { argName1 = val1 argName2 = val2 } Example call: -position 23.6,12.4,1452,803 Options object Option position = OptionBuilder.withArgName("longitude,latitude,altitude,speed") // .hasArgs(4) // .withValueSeparator(',') // .withDescription("use four arguments for something") // .create("position"); Will result in: position { longitude = 23.6 latitude = 12.4 altitude = 1452 speed = 803 }

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • fromCommandLine

        public static com.typesafe.config.Config fromCommandLine(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine cmd)
                                                  throws org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException

        Parsing rules

        non-arg options

         option-name = true
        Example call: -debug

        single-arg options

         option-name = argument
        Example call: -file /absolute/path

        property-arg options

         option-name {
    prop1 = val1
    prop2 = val2   
 }
        Example call: -D prop1=val1 -D prop2=val2

        multi-arg options

         option-name {
    argName1 = val1
    argName2 = val2   
 }

        Example call: -position 23.6,12.4,1452,803

        Options object 
         Option position = OptionBuilder.withArgName("longitude,latitude,altitude,speed") //
         .hasArgs(4) //
         .withValueSeparator(',') //
         .withDescription("use four arguments for something") //
         .create("position");
        Will result in: 
         position {
    longitude = 23.6
    latitude = 12.4   
    altitude = 1452
    speed = 803
 }

        Parameters:
        cmd -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException
